lang.word_default: You must complete the form fully
The file must be uploaded into the root folder and end with either '.xml' or '.xml.gz'
<u>OR</u> enter the filename of the XML file
Upload XML file from your computer
The file must end with either '.xml' or '.xml.gz'
Please ensure that you only install content blocks from trusted sources, as they could contain malicious code.

Below you can add content to the Block. HTML, smilies and BB-code are allowed. Newlines are NOT automatically converted, you should use <br />
The following variables are available: {blog.id}, {blog.name}, {blog.memberid}, {member.id}, {blog.url}, {base.url}
Enter part or all of the username
Choose a group as a moderator
Enter 0 to disable a per entry limit. This number must be less than the total amount.
Enter -1 to disable uploads or enter 0 to disable the limit
Total upload size for attachments (in KB)?
This will allow others to post on their blog(s).
Allow member to lock a skin to their blog(s)?
This is the maximum number of blogs that members of this group are allowed to create. Enter 0 to allow unlimited blogs.
Maximum upload size for attachments per entry (in KB)?
This will let the user choose a skin for their Blog. Skins available are settable in the blog settings.
Allow member to assign editors to their blog(s)?
This will only have effect if the user is allowed to create a hosted blog.
This will allow the member to create a private blog but specify additional members who can view it. Will only have effect if the user is allowed to create a private blog.
Allow member to create private club blogs?
When set, only (super-)moderators are able to publish the entries made.
Allow member to create private blogs?
Allow member to add polls in entries?
This will also have effect on other members' blogs.
Configure custom themes for your members
Allow member to use HTML in entries?
Allow member to use HTML in entry comments?
This will cause any default skin CSS not to be loaded - only the CSS defined below will be loaded
Use '{images}' as a macro for the 'Theme Images URL'. This CSS will override the skin CSS to customize the blog.
If your theme CSS calls images, enter the url to those images here
This will convert old attachment BBcode ([attachmentid=xxx]) to new style ([attachment=yyy:file.ext]) where yyy is the best guessed new ID of xxx.
This will recount comments and the entry last comment information for all your entries
If you have recently changed your domain name or moved your blogs to a new URL, you can use this tool to refresh the RSS feed caches.
This will recount the number of blogs, entries and comments and rebuild the last Blog created as shown in the Blog Statistics.
This will rebuild the thumbnails of the attachments. This will apply any changes made to the thumbnail size settings
This will recount entries, comments and the blog last post information for all your blogs
This is the name for your group and will be used in place of an owner's name
Members with a primary group or secondary group matching the selected groups will be able to access the blog as if it were their own
You must enter a display name!
You must enter a member name!
You must enter a blog name!
No member customized themes awaiting approval

Are you sure? If this user has included malicious CSS code in their theme, viewing the theme could result in your account being compromised. Only preview the theme after you have confirmed the theme CSS code is not malicious.

WARNING: Be sure to thoroughly inspect the CSS before approving it. Be suspicious of anything you do not know of the meaning of. It is advised you do not approve any CSS that loads data from a remote url, otherwise the user could change the contents of that file at any time without your knowledge. Be suspicious of things like @import, behavior, expression and moz-binding. These could be used to compromise your site in the right circumstances. If in doubt, do not approve the custom theme CSS
